events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was categorised as an auto accident type based on the details provided regarding the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to handle all communications and guide the customer through the claim process.
The customer received official acknowledgment of the claim submission along with information on next steps.
The insurer requested additional documents including police reports, photos of the vehicle damage, and vehicle registration.
The customer submitted the requested documents, including detailed photos of the damage and a police accident report.
An investigation was initiated to verify the circumstances of the vehicle collision and assess the damage.
The investigation concluded after reviewing evidence and statements, confirming the details of the auto accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs and medical expenses related to the accident.
The customer provided positive feedback about the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the communication process.
The claim was officially approved following acceptance of the settlement terms by the customer.
Insurance payment was issued promptly to cover the vehicle repair costs and related accident expenses.
The claim was officially closed after successful resolution and payment disbursement, concluding the process.
All records and documents related to the auto accident claim were securely archived for future reference.
